intro: Maharanga sinica var. sinica, commonly known as the Chinese maharanga, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
